article.headline: Mercer 98, Savannah State 81
article.story: SAVANNAH, Ga. (AP) -- James Odoms scored 19 points, 13 of them in the second half, to lead six Mercer players in double figures as the Bears defeated winless Savannah State 98-81 Thursday night. Jacob Skogen scored 16 and Will Emerson added 15 for Mercer (6-2), which lost an early lead and had to scramble back for a 39-38 halftime edge. Wesley Duke had 14 points and 12 rebounds, Damitrius Coleman had 11 points and eight assists, and Andrew Walker scored 10 for the Bears. Mark Williams led the Tigers (0-16) with 25 points, including 5-of-5 from 3-point range. Sherrard Reddick had 17 points and 10 rebounds, and Josh Barker scored 15. Consecutive 3-pointers by Williams turned a 2-point deficit into an 18-14 lead for Savannah State with 9:04 to play in the first half. Barker's basket with two seconds left gave the Tigers their last lead, 38-37, but Tyler McCurry scored as time expired to put the Bears up by 1. Mercer steadily pulled away in the second half and led by as many as 19 points, 91-72, with 3:05 remaining.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
